text: June 2, 2009 - Slaughter Testifies Before the International Trade Commission on Behalf of Buffalo Go
label: HH1

text: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE
label: HH1

text: Tuesday, June 2, 2009
label: TITLE

text: Slaughter Testifies Before the International Trade Commission on Behalf of Buffalo
label: BODY

text: Goodyear Tire Workers
label: HH1

text: Washington, DC - Congresswoman Louise M. Slaughter (D-NY-28), Chairwoman of the
label: BODY

text: House Committee on Rules, today testified before the International Trade Commission (ITC) on
label: BODY

text: behalf of workers at the Goodyear-Dunlop Tire plant in her district. Today the ITC met on a
label: BODY

text: United Steelworker's petition to limit imports of certain passenger vehicles and light truck tires
label: BODY

text: from China.
label: BODY

text: The full text of Rep. Slaughter's testimony, as prepared, follows:
label: BODY

text: Madame Chairman, members of the Commission, my name is Louise McIntosh Slaughter.  I
label: BODY

text: represent the people of the 28
label: BODY

text: th district of New York, which includes Rochester, Niagara Falls,
label: BODY

text: and parts of Buffalo.  Goodyear-Dunlop Tires North America has a major facility in my district.
label: BODY

text: On behalf of the over 1,000 workers at that facility as well as their families and neighbors I
label: BODY

text: welcome the opportunity to appear before you today to express my strong support for the
label: BODY

text: United Steelworkers' Section 421 petition on certain passenger vehicle and light truck tires from
label: BODY

text: June 2, 2009 - Slaughter Testifies Before the International Trade Commission on Behalf of Buffalo Go
label: HH1

text: China.
label: BODY

text: When this petition as brought to my attention and I was able to examine the facts, I
label: BODY

text: immediately thought that this is a "no brainer."  If the surge in consumer tires and the
label: BODY

text: adverse effect it has had on these American workers does not justify relief under the statute,
label: BODY

text: then what will?  I hope you will come to the same conclusion after what I know will be a
label: BODY

text: thoughtful and thorough investigation.
label: BODY

text: In 2008, China exported nearly 46 million consumer tires with a value of more than $1.7
label: BODY

text: billion.  This was 215 percent more than the 2004 level of imports by volume and 295 percent
label: BODY

text: more by dollar value.
label: BODY

text: In this period, domestic production of consumer tires declined by over 25 percent and the
label: BODY

text: domestic industry's share of the U.S. tire market declined from 63 percent in 2004 to below 50
label: BODY

text: percent in 2008.   Meanwhile, Chinese producers' share of the U.S. consumer tire market rose
label: BODY

text: from less than five percent to more than 17 percent.
label: BODY

text: As an inevitable result, American plants closed and American workers were sent home with an
label: BODY

text: uncertain fate.   Over 4,400 workers lost their jobs during the four year stretch and an additional
label: BODY

text: 2,400 face imminent job loss in 2009.   These layoffs are coming during the worst economic
label: BODY

text: crisis since the Great Depression, to the plight of these workers.
label: BODY

text: The bottom line is that it was no mere coincidence that these plant closings occurred over the
label: BODY

text: exact same period as the flood of Chinese imports claimed an ever larger share of the U.S.
label: BODY

text: market.
label: BODY

text: As I witnessed these disturbing trends, my heart is with the workers at the Goodyear-Dunlop
label: BODY

text: plant in Buffalo.   The plant opened in 1923.  More than one thousand men and women work
label: BODY

text: there producing a variety of tires including those that are the subject of this investigation.  They
label: BODY

text: are hardworking, skilled, productive employees who make high-quality products.  Now they are
label: BODY

text: looking at a very real possibility of job loss not because they cannot compete but because of an
label: BODY

text: import surge from China causing market disruption - exactly the type of situation that Congress
label: BODY

text: had in mind when Section 421 was adopted in 2000.  Indeed, just last November, Goodyear
label: BODY

text: announced that it was laying off 150 workers and scaling back production.
label: BODY

text: June 2, 2009 - Slaughter Testifies Before the International Trade Commission on Behalf of Buffalo Go
label: HH1

text: For these reasons, I support the USW's request for an annual import quota of 21 million
label: BODY

text: consumer passenger tires for a three-year period.  This would simply return imports from China
label: BODY

text: to the 2005 level and thus give U.S. producers a chance to adjust.  They can use this time to
label: BODY

text: restore their operating income to reasonable levels and invest in needed plant and equipment
label: BODY

text: upgrades and avoiding layoffs or shutdowns.   This will not only help the workers in my district
label: BODY

text: but also at tire manufacturing facilities throughout the country.  They will all benefit from having
label: BODY

text: a domestic source of high-quality, competitively-priced tires.
label: BODY

text: Madame Chairman, and members of the Commission, my district has seen more than its
label: BODY

text: share of job losses as a result of unfair foreign competition and dumping.  Once-great
label: BODY

text: companies have downsized, moved to China and other countries, or simply closed their doors
label: BODY

text: leaving people struggling to make ends meet.  The ripple effect on small local businesses has
label: BODY

text: resulted in even more job losses.  We are told so often by economists, corporate executives,
label: BODY

text: and political leaders from both parties how "free" trade is good for the country in a
label: BODY

text: broad sense, even when particular regions or sectors are sacrificed.
label: BODY

text: Well, it is not good for the country as a whole if manufacturing continues on the current
label: BODY

text: downward spiral- over four million jobs lost since 2001.  Manufacturing provides high-wage,
label: BODY

text: high-skilled jobs for millions of Americans.   Manufacturing makes possible the creation of a
label: BODY

text: strategic industrial base of products that are crucial to our national security.   Manufacturing is a
label: BODY

text: leading employer in thousands of communities across America.   Restoring and sustaining a
label: BODY

text: healthy manufacturing sector is essential for our long term national economic prosperity.  A
label: BODY

text: nation cannot be a superpower if it does not produce anything.
label: BODY

text: Trade remedies must be used in accordance with what those of us in the Congress spelled out
label: BODY

text: for you without fear of retaliation when they are fairly applied.  Trade remedies impact less than
label: BODY

text: one percent of our trade in a typical year.  However, these laws that provide redress against
label: BODY

text: egregious foreign trade practices are a critical component for our economic recovery.
label: BODY

text: All nations rely on remedies to address distortions that are inevitable in a world where, every
label: BODY

text: year, trillions of dollars worth of goods and services move between well over a hundred diverse
label: BODY

text: countries at various stages of economic development.  The World Trade Organization (WTO)
label: BODY

text: was created not only to promote trade but also to ensure that rules that govern trade are
label: BODY

text: available to all and mechanisms for settling disputes are as well.  Essentially, trading nations
label: BODY

text: have mutually agreed that there must be ways to ensure some level of fairness and to protect
label: BODY

text: their citizens from potential economic catastrophe.   Clearly, the 421 investigation before you is
label: BODY

text: June 2, 2009 - Slaughter Testifies Before the International Trade Commission on Behalf of Buffalo Go
label: HH1

text: entirely consistent with U.S. rights under the rules of the WTO - rules agreed to by the China in
label: BODY

text: 2000 as a condition for their accession to the WTO.
label: BODY

text: As Chairman of the House Rules Committee, I have been a student of rules governing the
label: BODY

text: legislative process in the House of Representatives.  We could not conduct the people's
label: BODY

text: business with 435 Members representing a wide array of regions and interests unless there
label: BODY

text: were rules of the road.  Members will disagree about the substance of legislation and
label: BODY

text: occasionally balk about the process.  Yet, the fact remains that the House's business is
label: BODY

text: conducted in a fair and orderly fashion and the rules that govern the House are taken
label: BODY

text: seriously.   The same principles should be applied to our nation's trade remedy laws in general
label: BODY

text: and Section 421 enforcement in particular.
label: BODY

text: Section 421 was put in place with these principles in mind when Congress voted to extend
label: HH1

text: Permanent Normal Trade Relations to China almost ten years ago.  I opposed China's
label: BODY

text: accession. I worried that the trade deficit with China, already disturbingly high, would continue
label: BODY

text: to ramp up to extraordinary levels.
label: BODY

text: Section 421 was created for precisely the kind of import surges and the impact on jobs we see
label: BODY

text: now in the domestic consumer and light truck tire market.  In the case before you, the proper
label: BODY

text: application of this statute will help save this important sector of our economy.  The cost of not
label: BODY

text: acting is too great.  Earlier in this decade I watched as another company in the Buffalo area,
label: BODY

text: Buffalo Color, fell victim to predatory trade practices.  Buffalo Color was forced to close its door
label: BODY

text: not because of an inferior product, or because it would not compete on a level playing field.  It
label: BODY

text: closed its doors because our own government failed to enforce our own trade laws and provide
label: BODY

text: relive from dumping that they deserved.
label: BODY

text: I want to be able to go back to my district and the people at that Goodyear-Dunlop plant in
label: BODY

text: Buffalo and tell them that this time the rules of trade have been fairly applied for their benefit.  I
label: BODY

text: urge you to make an affirmative determination and recommend the remedy requested to
label: BODY

text: President Obama who campaigned with the promise that our trade laws would be vigorously
label: BODY

text: enforced. If you do your part, I have faith that he will do his.
label: BODY

text: June 2, 2009 - Slaughter Testifies Before the International Trade Commission on Behalf of Buffalo Go
label: HH1
